intro: Malope anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian yellowcrown, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, lobed leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. Malope anatolica is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
